title: Recommendations for sans serif font to pair with IM Fell Great Primer Pro
content: Hi, Does anyone have a suggestion for a good sans serif font to pair with IM Fell? Overall look I'm going for is a bit of an old worldish feel. Thanks!
author: shazza2

comments.content:
**¶ Go check this page and the suggested pairings**  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/historical-allsorts/inside/fell-types](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211514/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/historical-allsorts/inside/fell-types "http://www.typography.com/fonts/historical-allsorts/inside/fell-types")
Thanks for your response. Checked it out, but only a couple of pairings there and neither are sans serifs.
I always recommend Storm’s [Sebastian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211514/http:/www.stormtype.com/family-sebastian.html) as the sans serif of historical ﬁctional.
